text:
Tomorrow I've got some friends and family coming 
around that I haven't seen for a long, long time.

It's going to be so nice to get everyone together 
and now it's time for an incredible dessert.

Semifreddo means semi-frozen and it's basically 
a homemade ice cream. We're going to flavour it with

chocolate. Chocolate... 100 grams goes in a little 
bowl over some simmering water. We'll melt that

down. I'll just crack the eggs and then I want to 
take out the lovely yolk and then a pinch of salt.

And that is stiff egg whites done. Part two is 
the cream. 200 millilitres in there and then add

100 grams of sugar to my double cream. We're gonna 
just whisk and what we want to achieve from this

is soft peaks. So, in this bowl here we have our 
chocolate. Then I'm gonna go in with a regular tin

of vanilla rice pudding and then we can go in 
with the egg yolks followed by 2 tablespoons

of cocoa. Put the cream in and the egg whites. We're 
just going to spin the bowl and fold. If you rough

it up, it won't have the air, it won't have the 
elegance. Here I've got a terrine mould. In here

with that amazing semifreddo. And let's get that 
in the freezer as quickly as possible. Get yourself

a little pan on a high heat there. I've got 200 
grams of golden caster sugar and we're going

to put around 50 mils of water into here. And as 
that's doing its business I want to show you how

to make a little spiced dust. So what I've got here 
is 2 heaped teaspoons of icing sugar or heaped

teaspoon of cocoa powder. Then I've got a teaspoon 
of the allspice cinnamon and coriander seeds.

But the other curveball is chilli. So I'm going 
to put it into a little spice grinder, liquidiser.

Oh it smells amazing. Get a little non-stick 
tray. Let's give it a little kiss of oil, to be

double sure nothing's gonna stick and what I will 
do is rub this across and I'll pour my praline

into that. So now that caramel is nice and dark, 
let's put those hazelnuts in nice and carefully,

don't touch it. That will be the most amazing 
amazing flavour. So that's your homemade caramel...

it's that simple. Done and dusted. Good to see you. So nice 
to see you, you okay.

I've done most of the important jobs yesterday so 
dessert in the freezer, semifreddo.... it's looking

amazing. And we can turn that out in here on a nice 
little platter. Now sprinkle this with our lovely

spice dust. This you can either smash up in 
a pestle and mortar or whack it in a machine.

You can finish it with just a few raspberries, 
strawberries. Who wants some semifreddo?

How do you put the rice in it? What rice? 
There is no rice. Dad, that is so nice. Delicious
